title: Further Development of Research Skills of Mid-Career Social Work Academics: Supportive Learning Sets, Mixed Methodologies and Research Placements
abstractText:
This aim of this project is to further develop the research skills of UK mid-career social work academics. As models for the social work students they teach, the ESRC investment has systemic benefits. Participants (50) will select from a menu of research related activities over 18 months:

  1. four 2-day research conferences on methodologies, eg evaluation of social work services
  2. support groups to meet 6 times in groups of 10, led by social work faculty Professor Donald Forrester (University of Bedfordshire), Professor Susan White (Birmingham University), Professor David Shemmings (Kent University), and Dr. Claudia Bernard (Goldsmiths College, University of London)
  3. mini-research placements offered to participants involving 12-24 days of supervised involvement at research centres/universities with interdisciplinary research teams starting January 2011
  4. a website with the information needed, eg onference programmes, placement descriptions, reading resources
  5. a writing retreat in June 2011 for participants who wish to protect time and attention in a supportive environment for writing research papers or bids.

The project director is Professor of Social Work Research, Dr. Lynn McDonald, Middlesex University, London.
